body_html:
@kirk86 can you collect a stack trace from the TensorFlow process while it's hanging? You can use gdb like this:

$ gdb
(gdb) attach <tensorflow process id>

If gdb gives you a weird message about ptrace, run the following in a terminal and try attaching again:
$ echo 0 | sudo tee /proc/sys/kernel/yama/ptrace_scope

Once you're attached in gdb, collect stack traces with all the threads:
(gdb) thread apply all bt
body_text:
@kirk86 can you collect a stack trace from the TensorFlow process while it's hanging? You can use gdb like this:
$ gdb
(gdb) attach <tensorflow process id>

If gdb gives you a weird message about ptrace, run the following in a terminal and try attaching again:
$ echo 0 | sudo tee /proc/sys/kernel/yama/ptrace_scope
Once you're attached in gdb, collect stack traces with all the threads:
(gdb) thread apply all bt
body:
@kirk86 can you collect a stack trace from the TensorFlow process while it's hanging? You can use gdb like this:
```
$ gdb
(gdb) attach <tensorflow process id>
```
If gdb gives you a weird message about ptrace, run the following in a terminal and try attaching again:
`$ echo 0 | sudo tee /proc/sys/kernel/yama/ptrace_scope`

Once you're attached in gdb, collect stack traces with all the threads:
`(gdb) thread apply all bt`
